title: (x) Slaters logo slab serif - Clarendon {Yves}
content:
can anyone shed light on this. I know its a simple one but...

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [6783\_SlatersLogo\_Black\_AW.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20120203231428/http:/typophile.com/files/6783_SlatersLogo_Black_AW.jpg) | 45.14 KB |
author: mik

comments.content: Also do you think it would be appropriate to use a serif with this main typeface?
it is clarendon. starbucks uses it a lot on their colateral pieces.

Yes, I think you could use a serif with this. I'd start by looking at the Century brood, followed by Miller and other distant relatives. Something with period quirkiness like Garamond 3 might also work.
